summary: The bill, titled the Protecting Investors’ Personally Identifiable Information Act, aims to prohibit the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) from requiring the collection of personally identifiable information (PII) under consolidated audit trail reporting requirements.  The bill defines PII and outlines exceptions where the SEC can request this information, specifically related to investigations of securities law violations or enforcement actions.  It also mandates the destruction of the PII within a day after the investigation concludes.
